messages.content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the capability of machines to mimic human cognitive functions such as learning, problem-solving, perception, and decision-making. AI systems are designed to work on tasks that require human intelligence, including visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and language translation【12:0†Understanding_Artificial_Intelligence.pdf】.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems. These processes include learning, reasoning, problem-solving, perception, and language understanding. AI has become a crucial part of the technology industry, helping to solve complex problems in computer science and many other fields【6:0†Understanding_Artificial_Intelligence.pdf】.

AI, or Artificial Intelligence, refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are designed to think and learn like humans. These machines can be programmed to perform tasks such as recognizing speech, solving problems, learning from data, and making decisions. AI can range from simple algorithms to advanced systems that can process large amounts of information to make informed decisions. 

Unfortunately, the specific definition from the "openai_question_answering_guide (1) (1).txt" document was not found, but the general idea of AI is as described above.
